body: Please try master as of a7cbe38ae2dd7e983a5e1bc31524fa9bd791727e or later

Server my friend

On Wed, Apr 11, 2018, 7:36 PM Henrik Jonsson <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> With a binary built at master @ a04440
> <https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/a04440>, bitcoind crashes with
> segfault on startup on one of my nodes.
>
> Expected: No segfault.
>
> Actual: Segfault, with no more info in debug.log, even with -debug set
> (see below).
>
> Crash seems reproducible, but only on this node. I'm recompiling with
> --enable-debug to see if that gives more info.
>
> Self-compiled at a04440 <https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/a04440>.
> Switching to the version built at 6324c6
> <https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/6324c6> that the node was
> running earlier starts up fine.
>
> Linux, armv7l, SSD disks.
>
> Debug logs:
>
> $ bitcoind -debug
> 2018-04-11T11:57:14Z

Alright @MarcoFalke, I started a build at latest HEAD (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/f15b72), will update here once it finishes.
@hkjn Did compiling a more recent master solve your problem? If so can you please close this issue.

Sorry for the delay (the armv7 build takes many hours, and the build machine ran out of disk the first time), but I can confirm that the crash on startup no longer happens at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/f15b72.

Closing.
